$description: Core spacing primitives defining the spatial system. Based on a 4px/0.25rem base unit with 8px grid alignment for consistency. Use spacing tokens for margins, paddings, and gaps. RULE: Always use spacing tokens instead of arbitrary values to maintain visual rhythm and consistency across the UI.

spacing.$description: Component-level spacing scale for padding, margins, and gaps. Follows a systematic scale from micro (2px) to macro (80px) spacing. Use 3xs-xs for compact UIs, sm-md for standard spacing, lg-xl for breathing room, and 2xl+ for section/page-level separation.

3xs.$description: Micro spacing (2px). Use for: hairline gaps, subtle visual separations, icon optical adjustments, fine-tuning alignment. Common in: stacked icons, tight inline elements, border spacing, minimal breathing room between dense elements.

2xs.$description: Very small spacing (4px). Use for: compact component internal gaps, tight list items, dense table cell padding, icon-to-text micro gaps. Common in: tags, badges, compact chips, dense data displays, inline code blocks.

xs.$description: Extra small spacing (8px). Use for: tight padding in compact components, icon-to-text gaps, small button padding, dense form layouts. Common in: small buttons, compact inputs, toolbar items, pill badges, tight card grids.

sm.$description: Small spacing (12px). Use for: standard component internal padding, form field padding, list item padding, comfortable compact UIs. Common in: buttons, inputs, dropdowns, list items, alert padding, menu items.

md.$description: Medium spacing (16px). DEFAULT spacing value. Use for: standard gaps between elements, default component padding, card content padding, form group spacing. Most common spacing value in the system - the baseline reference.

lg.$description: Large spacing (20px). Use for: generous component padding, separation between related groups, comfortable breathing room. Common in: card padding, dialog content padding, section sub-dividers, relaxed form layouts.

xl.$description: Extra large spacing (24px). Use for: modal/dialog padding, card spacing, comfortable content separation, generous component margins. Common in: modal containers, feature cards, dashboard panels, content sections.

2xl.$description: Double extra large spacing (32px). Use for: major content block separation, large card padding, section dividers within pages. Common in: page sections, hero content padding, feature showcases, spacious card layouts.

3xl.$description: Triple extra large spacing (40px). Use for: significant section separation, generous layout margins, prominent content blocks. Common in: landing page sections, dashboard section gaps, major content dividers.

4xl.$description: 4X large spacing (48px). Use for: large section breaks, page-level content separation, hero component internal spacing. Common in: page headers, major layout divisions, feature section padding.

5xl.$description: 5X large spacing (56px). Use for: substantial page section margins, generous hero padding, prominent content area separation. Common in: landing page hero sections, major page divisions, marketing layouts.

6xl.$description: 6X large spacing (64px). Use for: major page section breaks, hero section padding, significant layout whitespace. Common in: page-level section gaps, hero components, full-width content dividers.

7xl.$description: 7X large spacing (72px). Use for: very large section separation, expansive layout margins, premium whitespace. Common in: marketing pages, landing hero sections, high-emphasis content areas.

8xl.$description: 8X large spacing (80px). Maximum spacing value. Use for: largest section breaks, maximum page margins, expansive hero sections. Common in: landing page hero areas, major page divisions, spacious marketing layouts. Use sparingly - represents maximum breathing room.

gridSpacing.$description: Grid and layout gutter spacing based on 8px grid. Use for CSS Grid gap, Flexbox gap, and multi-column layout gutters. Pixel values for precise grid alignment. All values are multiples of 8px.

xs.$description: Extra small grid gap (8px). Use for: compact card grids, dense dashboard layouts, mobile-optimized grids, icon grids. Minimum comfortable gap for touch targets.

sm.$description: Small grid gap (16px). Use for: standard card grids, form layouts, compact dashboard grids. Good default for most grid layouts.

md.$description: Medium grid gap (24px). Use for: default content grids, spacious card layouts, comfortable dashboard grids. Balances density with readability.

lg.$description: Large grid gap (32px). Use for: spacious card layouts, content grids, marketing pages. Good for layouts with larger cards or content blocks.

xl.$description: Extra large grid gap (40px). Use for: hero grids, feature showcases, landing page layouts. Creates clear separation between grid items.

xxl.$description: Double extra large grid gap (48px). Use for: maximum separation in grids, presentation layouts, sparse artistic layouts. Rarely needed - consider if layout needs restructuring.

verticalRhythm.$description: Baseline-aligned spacing for vertical rhythm in typography-heavy layouts. Based on 1.6rem (25.6px) baseline. Use for consistent vertical spacing in prose content, documentation, and text-heavy interfaces. Maintains readable flow in long-form content.

xs.$description: Quarter baseline (6.4px). Use for: list item spacing within tight lists, line spacing adjustments, micro-spacing in prose. Minimal vertical separation.

sm.$description: Half baseline (12.8px). Use for: heading bottom margins, spacing after inline elements, paragraph-adjacent element spacing. Creates subtle but noticeable separation.

md.$description: Single baseline (25.6px). DEFAULT prose spacing. Use for: paragraph margins, standard content block spacing, default vertical rhythm. One full line height of separation.

lg.$description: 1.5 baselines (38.4px). Use for: heading top margins, spacing before new sections within content, emphasis breaks. Creates clear topic transitions.

xl.$description: Double baseline (51.2px). Use for: major section breaks in prose, chapter-level separations, significant content divisions. Two full line heights of separation.

2xl.$description: Triple baseline (76.8px). Use for: page section breaks, major content area separations, hero-to-content transitions. Maximum prose spacing - use sparingly.
